# isExclusive

**Instance Property**

A Boolean value that indicates whether the field node should override all other field nodes that might otherwise affect physics bodies.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor var isExclusive: Bool { get set }
```

```swift
var isExclusive: Bool { get set }
```

## Discussion

If the value is set to [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/true] and a physics body is within this field’s region, all other field nodes that might otherwise affect this body are ignored. The default value is [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/false].

If you set this property to [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/true] on multiple field nodes within a scene, their regions should not overlap. If they do, the results are undefined.

## Determining Which Physics Bodies Are Affected by the Field

- **isEnabled**: A Boolean value that indicates whether the field is active.
- **region**: The area (relative to the node’s origin) that the field affects.
- **minimumRadius**: The minimum value for distance-based effects.
- **categoryBitMask**: A mask that defines which categories this field belongs to.
